Name: Love
Details: Gives the unit +1 HP for every bond level, maximum is 20. If the unit loses bond level, the bonus is also reduced. Good for Riordan who has access to his bond partners available early.

Name: Blazing
Details: When the unit attacks, there is a 10% chance for the unit's base damage to be 50% more than the damage indicated in the battle forecast. This bonus damage triggers before critical hits are calculated. Good for units that has high damage output.

Name: Prophet
Details: Increases the target's Accuracy by 25 when he/she receives a healing effect from wearer. Can be triggered multiple times on a single heal if there is more than one target healed. Also triggers over multiple turns for Haoran's personal skill. Recommended for heals with multiple targets, like Waveseer, Tidecaller and Khamari, as well as healing over time like Haoran.

Name: Attuned
Details: Wearer starts the chapter with 250 mana, instead of the usual 100. However, the wearer no longer regains 20 mana at the start of each turn. Other ways of gaining mana are not affected, like passive abilities, Charged ring or Empyrean rune. As units only start to generate mana on turn 2, and generates 20 per turn, Attuned ring lets the wearer to have more mana in total up until turn 8, only from turn 9 onwards (other than Arthur) would the ring actually start to affect the unit negatively. Good for classes which uses up a lot of mana right away, like Ascendant and Godfrost.

Name: Kindling
Details: Increase power by 1 every time mana is used, works on active skills usage, as well as mana depletion from Mashal's passive. it is a good choice for Mashal as her personal skill allows her to proc Kindling ring's effect multiple times per turn, as opposed to maximum 1 per turn most other units can.*Check if affected by Powered rune.

Name: Cleave
Details: Single target Red skills now only deals half the normal damage on its initial target, but also deals half the normal damage to all surronding enemy units. The mass reduction in damage dealt to initial target is very undesirable, making Cleave ring one of the worst rings in game. The ring also has no effect on skills that targets area or more than one target. It is recommended to avoid using this ring, as it is not worth the trade-off.

Name: Tranquility
Details: Gains 8 Frt if no allies within 2 tile radius. Good for solo tank strategies. 8 Frt is quite a sizable amount, vastly improves a unit's survivability if he/she is within range of multiple Magical enemies. Good for generic Godfrost, which is a tank class but has much lower Frt than Def.

Name: Harmony
Details: *Check if affect self

Name: Farseer
Details: If a skill has "Range +1" or "Size of AOE +1" as its upgrade option, they turn into "Range +2" or "Size of AOE +2" respectively. The ring functions similiarly to Archmage ring, but is superior when a skill has size upgrade, or have more than one "Range +1" upgrade option. Examples of Class that can utilise this ring well includes but not limited to Cutthroat, Warlock and Elementalist.

Name: Depth
Details: Dodge increases by final Power of the wearer, will include any Power buffing effects. Good on dodge tanks, giving them a sizable buff to Dodge. Quickdraw/Deadeye has both good Speed and Might to make use of this ring, Gale/Tempest, Nightblade/Ancarant and Cutthroat/Slayer can utilise this ring well too.

Name: Grip
Details: Ignoring half of weapon's Weight, rounded down, basically increasing TSpd as well as Dodge. Heaviest weapons in this game has 8 weight, so this rune can give its wearer 4 extra TSpd and 8 Dodge maximum (5 and 10 respecitvely for Riordan). Good on units with heavy weapons, most notably Riordan, whose passive increases weapon Weight by 20%. Note that this ring is useless on Tusk, whose passive ignores weapon Weight completely.

Name: Hallowed
Details: Increases Def and Frt if the wearer uses the "Wait" command. The effect does not trigger if player ends the turn automatically, or if the unit performs Attack, uses Red skills, or interact with surronding (open chest, light torches, put out flames, etc.). However, the wearer can trigger the ring's effect if he/she uses a Green or Blue skill before ending the turn with the "Wait" command. Great for tanking classes that does not rely on player phase combat, such as Juggernaut/Dreadnought, Aegis and Frigillan/Godfrost.

Name: Mystic
Details: Increases the Mas scaling part of a skill by 25%. For example,if a skill has 5+50% Mas scaling as value description, the "50%" part increases by 25% of its value and becomes 62.5%, while the base 5 is unchanged. Good for units with high Mas and have skills with high Mas scalings, such as Cosmician. Note that the ring effects works multiplicatively with Mas scaling increasing upgrades as well.

Name: Soul
Details: Extra bond XP quickens the process of gaining bond levels. Good for units that need fast bond levels such as Riordan. Also helps players get their desired ores from bond conversations faster.

Name: Victorious
Details: Heals by 20% of maximum HP every time the wearer defeats an enemy, both on player phase and enemy phase, and can be triggered by both combat kills and skill damage kills. Good for tanky combat units that can reliable take out enemies in one round of combat, such as Repulsor Shield+Wreathed in Flame Juggernaut/Dreadnought.

Name: Solitude
Details: Gains 25 Accuracy if no bonded allies within 2 tile radius. Good for Ellisant or Reaper who can perform combat away from the rest of the party.

Name: Inferno
Details: Increase the first scalable number of certain skills by 40%. Skills affected by this ring includes: Wreathed in Flame(number of attacks), Hellfire(damage), Meteor(damage), Flame Strike(damage), Flame Infusion(critical), Illuminate(accuracy), Eternal Sun(accuracy). Good for units that has skills from this list, such as Warlock/Geomancer.

Name: Karmic
Details: Works similiarly to Aegis's passive. Good for units who has good bulk and has good damage like Champion.

Name: Charged
Details: Increase mana recovery from 20 to 25. Good for any class that uses a lot of skills like Geomancer/Cosmician, Warlock, or Ascendant and Godfrost who need to keep effects of their core skills up.

Name: Chosen
Details: Every attack instance can only deal 40% of wearer's max HP rounded down at maximum, ensuring that it will take a minimum of 3 attacks to defeat the wearer regardless of bulk. Great for healing tanks like Warlock and Ritualists, who do not have the defenses to tank but can easily heal a lot of HP back during combat. Pretty much essential for the two class' tank strategy to work.

Name: Ghoul
Details: Slightly increases te wearer's Frt, more effective if the wearer uses a heavier weapon. Synergetic for Riordan or Tusk in Ranger/Warden, which is a tank class weak in Frt and uses Axe, a heavy weapon type, but not very effective especially later in game.

Name: Dauntless
Details: Increase Def and Frt based on number on enemies within 2 tile range, good for tank units intending to face groups of enemies.

Name: Dimming
Details: Reduce Mas to 0 and increase Def and Frt by 1/3 the amount rounded down. Makes thr wearer's skill much less effective in exchange for more bulk. Good for tanky units that do not rely on its own skills, such as Champion, Warden or Dreadnought.

Name: Siphon
Details: Simple increase in XP gain, which is useful for any unit that players need to increase the level of.

Name: Lava
Details: Increase the skill number in skill description by 20%, if more than 1 such numbers exists in a skill, both are increased by 20%. The effect of Lava ring stacks multiplicatively with and Mas scaling or base number increasing upgrades.

Name: Calamity
Details: Wearer heals by 2 HP every time an enemy dies on the map, regardless of who defeated said enemy. Good for units who do not have the time or opportunity to get healed, such as healers themselves. Also works well in tandem with Victorious ring, as the two rings can heal on the same kill.

Name: Brightening
Details: Increases the target's Mgt by 4 when he/she receives a healing effect from wearer. Can be triggered multiple times on a single heal if there is more than one target healed. Also triggers over multiple turns for Haoran's personal skill. Recommended for heals with multiple targets, like Waveseer, Tidecaller and Khamari, as well as healing over time like Haoran.

Name: Saint
Details: Effectively increases wearer's Def and Frt by 4 if the attacking enemy is a 1-range attacker. Also can support allies if they are hit by enemies adjacent to the wearer. Good for tanky units, especially those with good Frt who can tank most 2-range enemies without issue.

Name: Antimage
Details: Take less and deal more damage to Magical enemies. Generic Magical units include Treant, Oak Treant, Magi, Paladin, Sorcerer, Priest, Overseer, Surge, Witch and Zealot. Good for units that can tank Physical enemies well but struggles against Magical enemies.

Name: Flux
Details: Average the final battle forecast Accuracy between wearer and the other combatant. Good for units with poor Accuracy and Dodge such as Juggernaut(not Dreadnought), Ranger/Warden, and Frigillan/Godfrost. Good against enemies with high Dodge such as Rogue, Sellsword and Witch. Also synergies with Indomitable ring, as it lowers wearer's Accuracy and Dodge.

Name: Companion
Details: Reduce mana cost of all Red skills of Hunter classline by 10. Good for any class in Hunter classline that is not Beastmaster, as Beastmaster already halves any mana cost on Red skills and Companion ring's effecy will be rduced to 5 by Beastmaster's passive..

Name: Competitor
Details: When the wearer defeats an opponent, his/her Power increases by 1. Good for units that can get a lot of kills in a battle. Recommended for units/classes that have effect related to kills, like Zanele, Deadeye, Stormkeeper and Bursting rune.

Name: Indomitable
Details: Increases defenses by 4 while reducing Spd and Dex. The wearer's Crit will be reduced by 0.5 point, an insignificant amount that may not even matter at times due to rounding down of decimal places. Dodge and Accuracy will be reduced by 5, a small but sometimes needed amount, as well as 2 points of TSpd. Recommended for classes that are used to tank but does not care much about Spd, Dodge or Accuracy. Best used on Dreadnought who cannot miss or dodge in the first place, also useful on Godfrost or Relic Knight.

Name: Soulfire
Details: If an attack hits but does not crit, it now has a 10% chance to crit. Actual increase in crit chance = hit chance * (1-crit chance) * 10%. Good for units with good hit but not so good crit, like Dreanought, Deadeye or Ellisant.

Name: Hurricane
Details: Flat Movement +1. Every unit in this game bar Zuhair and certain enemies with special buffs has 5 movements. Increasing Movement can give units a safe way to strike enemies first from outside enemy attack range. Good for any unit that have 2 range, or simply give Zuhair to maximise movement.

Name: Diplomat
Details: Gives wearer 25 Dodge if defeats an enemy, either through battle or skills. Stacks on enemy phase if multiple enemies are defeated, but is hampered by the 15 stacks of Exhaustion that also stacks with multiple battles in one phase. Good for units with kill Power and wants Dodge, like Slayer, Tempest and Ancarant.

Name: Equilibrium
Details: The unit's Def and Frt are averaged, round down if there is decimal place. Note that this occurs before any passives are factored in, so Khamari's Frt will still be 25% higher than his Def if he equips this ring. Useful for units with high defenses total but have vastly different Def and Frt, such as Ranger/Warden, Gallant/Champion or non-Zuhair Frigillan/Godfrost.

Name: Sacred
Details: Heals wearer for 10% of mana usage if he/she uses mana. Depleting mana such as Mashal's personal or Powered rune does not count. Useful for anyone who uses a large amount of mana, such as Godfrost, or healers who cannot heal themselves. Very synergetic with Elemental ring for double bulk increase on mana usage.

Name: Dominator
Details: Increase Crit by 10 if HP is full. Will lose this buff on follow-up attack in the same round of combat if wearer takes damage mid-battle. Great for Devoted/Reaper, Conduit/Stormkeeper or Tal'Dera who wants to crit.

Name: Sanctified
Details: Swaps wearer's Def and Mgt, effective on a unit with vastly different Def and Mgt, such as Warlock, who uses skills and seldom actively engage in combat. Sanctified ring will vastly improve unit's survivability while not hindering the ability to devastate enemies with skills.

Name: Radiance
Details: Applies Blind to enemies damaged by wearer's skills. Great for Conduit/Stormkeeper or Elementalist/Spirit Keeper, as they have AOE damage skills capable of hitting multiple enemies at once but does not kill them outright.

Name: Drunkard
Details: If a unit does not dodge an attack, the unit now has another 10% chance to dodge. Effectiveness is affected by the unit's own base Dodge. Actual increase in Dodge = (1 - base Dodge) * 10%. Not good for high dodge units as actual effectiveness is very low, but can be useful for Gale/Tempest or Quickdraw/Deadeye who has good Spd but no inherent Dodge increasing passives.

Name: Solemn
Details: Wearer in fact loses all chance to dodge, but instead gets hit for half damage. Not good for frail dodge tanks but can be used for strategies that needs enemies to hit, such as Plague ring Ritualist, or Repulsor Shield targets such as Juggernaut(not Dreanought), or Frigillan/Godfrost.

Name: Aqua
Details: Increase the first scalable number of certain skills by 40%. Skills affected by this ring includes: Call of the Storm (total damage), Mist of Renewal (healing), Healing Wave (number of targets), Whirlpool (duration, but only if you increase the duration to 2 or more first), Chain Heal (healing), Ice Shield (block stacks), Absolute Zero (defenses boost). Great for Godfrost as the ring will provide the singles biggest buff for Godfrost's signature ability: Absolute Zero.

Name: Storm
Details: Deals damage to adjacent enemies if the wearer uses the "Wait" command. The effect does not trigger if player ends the turn automatically, or if the unit performs Attack, uses Red skills, or interact with surronding (open chest, light torches, put out flames, etc.). However, the wearer can trigger the ring's effect if he/she uses a Green or Blue skill before ending the turn with the "Wait" command. Effective for tanks who rushes into horde of enemies.

Name: Surefire
Details: Adds Mas * 0.5 to wearer's Accuracy formula. Useful on higher difficulties where enemy Dodges are much higher. Good on units with high Mas like Nightblade/Ancarant or Tamer/Beastmaster to ensure accurate attacks.

Name: Archmage
Details: If the maximum range of a skill is 2 or higher, Archmage increases the range by 1. Ring effect also applies for skills that only have 2 or more range after applying a "Range +1" upgrade. The effect also applies to skills that have same range as a normal attack, like Gwyn's personal or all Red skills from Hunter classline, provided the unit has a maximum attack range of 2, effectively letting these units attack at 3 range. Good for units who wants long range skills like Cosmician, Elementalist/Spirit Keeper, etc.

Name: Destiny
Details: Increases Crit if the wearer uses the "Wait" command. The effect does not trigger if player ends the turn automatically, or if the unit performs Attack, uses Red skills, or interact with surronding (open chest, light torches, put out flames, etc.). However, the wearer can trigger the ring's effect if he/she uses a Green or Blue skill before ending the turn with the "Wait" command. Massive increase in Crit benefits Devoted/Reaper who lives and dies by Crit. Reaper can use Reaper's Mark(with Duration +1 and Self-Cast upgrade) and wait for massive Crit chance during enemy phase or next turn. Also helpful for Tal'Dera or Conduit/Stormkeeper.

Name: Heir
Details: Increase Mas by 1 for every 10 point in HP, no decimal places, up to 10 when unit hits 100 HP. Great for classes with strong skills and good HP like Godfrost or Beastmaster. Also good for classes that just wants more Mas, like Geomancer/Cosmician or Warlock.

Name: Guardian
Details: Increases Def and Frt when unit falls below half HP, can activate mid battle if enemy doubles and bring unit's HP down below half on first hit. Deactivates at similiar condition too. Great synergy with Ranger's passive, vastly increasing wearer's bulk in a pinch. Good for generic tank classes such as Warden, Dreanought or Godfrost.

Name: Elemental
Details: Increase bulk by giving unit more block on mana usage. Depleting mana such as Mashal's personal or Powered rune does not count. Useful for anyone who uses a large amount of mana, such as Godfrost, or healers who cannot heal themselves. Synergetic with Sacred ring for double effective bulk increase on mana usage.

Name: Astral
Details: Gains mana after a round of combat. Does not recover more mana if double the enemy. Good for units with high mana usage that also takes part in combat, like Elementalist/Spirit Keeper or Conduit/Stormkeeper. Can be used with Attuned ring to allow for mana recovery despite Attuned ring's negative effect.

Name: Lifebinder
Details: Increase the amount of healing by 50%, rounded down. Great for healers, like all Shaman classline units, allowing them to almost fully heals any injured allies.

Name: Advantage
Details: Actually ignores 2% of enemy resistances (both Def and Frt) per point in Mas. A 30 Mas unit effectively lowers enemy defenses to 1/3 the original amount. Great ring for Valeria and Nightblade/Ancarant, as they have great Mas but very low base Power and damage.

Name: Plague
Details: Inflict Bleed on enemies if the wearer is hit by attack. Does not apply Bleed if the attack misses. Essential for Ritualist to pull-off their tanking strategy alongside their passive. Pair thie ring up with Solemn ring if players choose such a strategy. Otherwise good with Juggernaut/Dreadnought, Frigillan/Godfrost, Ranger/Warden or Aegis/Relic Knight, as these classes can take a hit but are not very good at dealing huge damage back.

Name: Bloodied
Details: Increases all secondary stats, including TSpd, base on Max HP, maximum provides 8 points to all secondary stats. The biggest potential increase to TSpd any ring can give. Great for any combat classes, regardless of HP.
